Summary: large set pattern of lights seen in distance flying in circular pattern, occasionally fading out then returning for about 10 minutes.
divs: Sighting DetailsAt our son's 3rd birthday party on July 3, 2012 at about 21:45, we were getting ready to start setting up for fireworks, when in the distance we (approximately 16 people) noticed a large semi-rigid pattern of lights about 1-2 miles away. The region is rural countryside, very low light pollution. It was flying in a circular pattern for about 10 minutes with a large radius to the flight path. During the observation, the lights would occasionally fade out and return, but with no set pattern to the fading and return to visibility. I had my camera (a Canon DSLR) and was able to snap 3 pictures. I was having difficulty focusing due to the distance and darkness. One picture came out fairly decent, but the other 2 suffer from camera shake. I zoomed in on the one good one and found 5 white lights and 1 red light.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Pleasant Hill
There were no other sightings in Pleasant Hill on or around July 3rd 2012
